Originally announced in February, XCOM: Enemy Unknown for Mac comes packaged as part of a special Elite Edition, which includes additional add-on content like the Slingshot Pack, the Elite Soldier Pack, the Second Wave update and the game's soundtrack.

@denbronco

You need to "Allow applications downloaded from: Anywhere" in System Preferences -> Security & Privacy -> General tab

I had the same issue and started messing around with the files, then tried this solution. You can also change that setting back to a different option after you run the app once...

See also: http://www.yourkit.com/download/mountain_lion.html

@jimsghost  There are two ways to find the saved files.  

First Way
1. Open a new Finder window
2. Click on Go in the Menu bar, which will show the hidden Library folder.
3. Click on Library in the Go menu, and your Finder window will open to the hidden Library folder within your user folder
4. Navigate from there to ~/Library/Application Support/Feral Interactive/XCOM Enemy Unknown - Elite Edition/Save Data

Second Way
1. Open a new terminal window
2. Copy/Paste this:  defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles -bool true
3. Copy/Paste this:  killall Finder
4.  Navigate to the same hidden library folder which will be shown now
5.  After you're done, Copy/Paste this in the Terminal:  defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles -bool false
6.  Copy/Paste this:  killall Finder
7.  And you're done.

Cheers!
